page.title: 01PARISH OF CLANFIELD
page.content: A farming and sparsely populated area bordering on the rapidly developing village of Clanfield in Hampshire. The nearest town and railway station is Petersfield, 8 Km.away on the main London to Portsmouth trunk road.The nearest post office, shops and medical units are situated in the the nearby village of Clanfield. Many tourists visit the area, the attraction being the Queen Elizabeth Country Park administered jointly by Hampshire County Council and the Forestry Commission.Many leisure activities are held in the park such as hang-gliding and craft demonstrations. Dairy cattle are grazed in the area and cereal crops grown on the farmland. The countryside is mixed woodland and open downland and is of outstanding natural beauty with panoramic views of Sussex and the Isle of Wight.
